paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variant information including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Furthermore, a BRCA2 mutation found in a proband was also identified in two unaffected relatives.
Furthermore, a BRCA2 mutation found in a proband was also identified in two unaffected relatives.

functional_data.summary: The missense mutation p.I2675V is predicted to be causative because it generates a donor site within exon 18 that causes an in-frame deletion and splicing defect.

variants.segregation_data: The BRCA2 mutation segregated with unaffected relatives.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was not registered in the BIC database, suggesting it is novel.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 missense mutation p.I2675V (c.8023A>G) was predicted to be causative because it generates a donor site within exon 18 that causes an in-frame deletion and splicing defect.

functional_data.summary: The frameshift mutation is expected to lead to a truncated protein.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was not registered in the BIC database, suggesting it is novel.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: To determine whether unaffected relatives carry the same deleterious mutations as the probands, we enrolled two unaffected relatives of an ovarian patient harboring BRCA2 p.S1882X (c.5645C>A).

functional_data.summary: The nonsense mutation is expected to lead to a truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation was found in the proband and also detected in unaffected relatives.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is associated with ovarian cancer.

tables_processed.table_caption: Deleterious mutations found in breast and/or ovarian cancer patients (n = 135).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
